answers.answer: You do not get gestational diabetes from your sugar intake.  This is a HUGE myth.  You get it from your pancreas malfunctioning. It's the luck of the draw thing.  But your sugar consumption IN NO WAY affects this.  Large amounts of sugar are just not healthy in themselves though.
There is some research that says that the placenta is actually to blame for this insulin resistance too.  Only about 18-20% of expecting mothers get gd.

I agree with factorymomma. A bunch of my used to be friends ate tons upon tons of sugar (candy, chocolate, cake, soda, etc) & they didn't have any problems ... Besides gaining too much weight too fast.
